title.en: Check species names in biodiversity data from separate sources (3/5)

description.en: This process XYZ HERE PLEASE, from the sources GBIF, iNaturalist and VertNet, with data provided by the user or other sources. For more details, please ask BOKU.

input_data.title: Occurrence data
input_data.description: URL to a table containing the occurrences from any source. This can be the outcome of the matchdata process.

colname_species.title: Column name: Species
colname_species.description: Column name that indicate the Species in the provided datases. Example: "species"

species_names.title: Species names
species_names.description: List of species about which to retrieve data, as a comma-separated list. Example: "Squalius cephalus, Salmo trutta, Thymallus thymallus, Anguilla anguilla"

pct.title: pct number
pct.description: The percentage that indicates the errorness for the species to be accepted for it to be replaced with the database name. Mostly fish species names are qualitt controlled.

bool_merge.title: True or False: Merge?
bool_merge.description: If a dataframe with species names is provided and merge is true, then all columns are returned. For only one species, the merge will be set automatically to false.

cleannames_df.title: XYZ HERE PLEASE
cleannames_df.description: A table containing a column speciescheck with names checked with databases for consistency. For fish species, FishBase is used as a standard database.
